20 Provinsi Telah Umumkan Kenaikan Standar Upah Tahun Depan
01 Nov 2019, 14:11 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Dewi Rina Cahyani
Tempo.Co, Jakarta - Sebanyak 20 provinsi telah mengumumkan kenaikan standar upah 2020 pada sore ini, Jumat, 1 November 2019. Laporan kenaikan upah tersebut telah diterima oleh Kementerian Ketenagakerjaan.
"Hari ini kita terus melakukan pemantauan dan pengumpulan laporan penetapan UMP dari daerah-daerah dari seluruh Indonesia," tutur Direktur Jenderal Pembinaan Hubungan Industrial dan Jaminan Sosial Tenaga Kerja Kementerian Ketenagakerjaan Haiyani Rumondang dalam keterangannya, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Kenaikan upah ini mengacu pada data inflasi dan pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional yang dikeluarkan oleh Badan Pusat Statistik. Menurut data itu, upah minimum provinsi 2020 masing-masing naik sebesar 8,51.
Haiyani mengatakan perhitungan kenaikan upah minimum provinsi atau UMP juga tertuang dalam Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) Nomor 78 Tahun 2015 tentang Pengupahan. Adapun penetapan UMP 2020 yang diumumkan serentak oleh gubernur tiap-tiap provinsi dilegalkan dalam keputusan gubernur sesuai dengan Pasal 9 Peraturan Menteri Ketenagakerjaan Nomor 15 Tahun 2018 tentang Upah Minimum.
Sementara itu, Direktur Pengupahan Kemnaker Dinar Titus Jogaswitani menyatakan, hingga pukul 18.00 WIB sore tadi, masih ada satu dari 20 provinsi yang masih belum menetapkan upah sesuai dengan aturan. Tidak dijelaskan provinsi apa yang dimaksud.
Di sisi lain, Kemenaker juga memantau provinsi- provinsi yang belum menyampaikan laporannya. Ia menduga provinsi yang belum melapor ini telah menetapkan kenaikan ulah, namum belum melegalkannya dalam surat keputusa. "Keputusannya belum ditandatangani oleh gubernur atau belum disampaikan kepada kami," ucapnya.
Bekas Menteri Ketenagakerjaan, Hanif Dhakiri, sebelumnya mengeluarkan surat edaran bernomor B-M/308/HI.01.00/X/2019. Surat itu berisi penyampaian data tingkat inflasi nasional dan pertumbuhan produk domestik bruto tahun 2019.
Dalam surat edaran tersebut, ia menjelaskan kenaikan upah dihitung berdasarkan data BPS inflasi nasional 3,39 persen ditambah dengan pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional 5,12 persen. Dari hasil pertambahan itu, pemerintah dapat menentukan tingkat kenaikan upah pada 2020.

20 Provinces Have Announced Increase in Wage Standards Next Year
01 Nov 2019, 14:11 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Dewi Rina Cahyani
Tempo.Co, Jakarta - A total of 20 provinces have announced an increase in the 2020 wage standard this afternoon, Friday, November 1, 2019. The wage increase report has been received by the Ministry of Manpower.
"Today we continue to monitor and compile reports on the determination of UMP from regions from all over Indonesia," said Director General of Industrial Relations Development and Labor Social Security of the Ministry of Manpower Haiyani Rumondang in her statement, Friday, November 1, 2019.
This wage increase refers to data on inflation and national economic growth released by the Central Statistics Agency. According to the data, the 2020 provincial minimum wage each rose by 8.51.
Haiyani said the calculation of the provincial minimum wage increase or UMP was also contained in Government Regulation (PP) No. 78 of 2015 concerning Wages. The stipulation of the 2020 UMP that was announced simultaneously by the governors of each province was legalized in the governor's decision in accordance with Article 9 of the Minister of Manpower Regulation No. 15 of 2018 concerning Minimum Wages.
Meanwhile, Dinar Titus Jogaswitani, the Managing Director of Wages, said that as of 18:00 WIB this afternoon, there was still one of 20 provinces that had not yet set wages according to the regulations. Not explained what province meant.
On the other hand, the MoM also monitors provinces that have not yet submitted their reports. He suspects that the province which has not yet reported this has set a tantrum increase, but has not legalized it in the decree. "The decision has not been signed by the governor or has not been conveyed to us," he said.
Former Minister of Manpower, Hanif Dhakiri, previously issued a circular numbered B-M / 308 / HI.01.00 / X / 2019. The letter contained data on national inflation and 2019 gross domestic product growth.
In the circular, he explained that wage increases were calculated based on BPS national inflation data of 3.39 percent plus national economic growth of 5.12 percent. From the results of the increase, the government can determine the level of wage increases in 2020.
